body:
raven.cr • the Crystal client for Sentry



  
  
  
  
  


An unofficial Crystal-language client and integration layer for the [Sentry](https://github.com/getsentry/sentry) error reporting API.

Based on fine [raven-ruby](https://github.com/getsentry/raven-ruby) gem
from folks at [@getsentry](https://github.com/getsentry).

### Blog posts

- [Crystal error tracking with Sentry](https://sija.pl/en/notes/crystal-error-tracking-with-sentry)
- [Sentry error tracking for Kemal](https://sija.pl/en/notes/sentry-error-tracking-for-kemal)

## Features

- [x] Processors (data scrubbers)
- [x] Interfaces (Message, Exception, Stacktrace, User, HTTP, ...)
- [x] Contexts (user, tags, extra, os, runtime)
- [x] Breadcrumbs
- [x] Integrations ([Kemal](https://github.com/kemalcr/kemal), [Amber](https://github.com/amberframework/amber), [Lucky](https://github.com/luckyframework/lucky), [Sidekiq.cr](https://github.com/mperham/sidekiq.cr), [action-controller](https://github.com/spider-gazelle/action-controller))
- [x] Async support
- [x] User Feedback
- [x] Source code context for stack traces
- [x] Dedicated [`Log`](https://crystal-lang.org/api/Log.html) backend
- [x] Crash Handler

## Installation

Add this to your application's `shard.yml`:

```yaml
dependencies:
  raven:
    github: Sija/raven.cr
```

## Usage

```crystal
require "raven"
```

### Raven only runs when SENTRY_DSN is set

Raven will capture and send exceptions to the Sentry server whenever its DSN is set.
This makes environment-based configuration easy - if you don't want to send
errors in a certain environment, just don't set the DSN in that environment!

```sh
# Set your SENTRY_DSN environment variable.
export SENTRY_DSN=https://public@example.com/project-id
```

```crystal
# Or you can configure the client in the code (not recommended - keep your DSN secret!)
Raven.configure do |config|
  config.dsn = "https://public@example.com/project-id"
end
```

### Raven doesn't report some kinds of data by default

If used with integrations, Raven ignores some exceptions by default - most of
these are related to 404s or controller actions not being found.

Raven doesn't report `POST`, `PUT`, `PATCH` data or cookies by default.
In addition, it will attempt to remove any obviously sensitive data,
such as credit card or Social Security numbers.
For more information about how Sentry processes your data, [check out the documentation on the `processors` config setting.](https://docs.sentry.io/clients/ruby/config/)

### Call

Raven supports two methods of capturing exceptions:

```crystal
Raven.capture do
  # capture any exceptions which happen during execution of this block
  1 // 0
end

begin
  1 // 0
rescue ex : DivisionByZeroError
  Raven.capture(ex)
end
```

### More configuration

You're all set - but there are a few more settings you may want to know about too!

#### DSN

While we advise that you set your Sentry DSN through the `SENTRY_DSN` environment
variable, there are two other configuration settings for controlling Raven:

```crystal
# DSN can be configured as a config setting instead.
# Place in config/initializers or similar.
Raven.configure do |config|
  config.dsn = "your_dsn"
end
```

And, while not necessary if using `SENTRY_DSN`, you can also provide an
`environments` setting. Raven will only capture events when
`SENTRY_ENVIRONMENT` matches an environment on the list.

```crystal
Raven.configure do |config|
  config.environments = %w(staging production)
end
```

#### async

When an error or message occurs, the notification is immediately sent to Sentry.
Raven can be configured to send asynchronously:

```crystal
# define your own handler
config.async = ->(event : Raven::Event) {
  spawn { Raven.send_event(event) }
}
# or use default implementation based on fibers (i.e. the one above)
config.async = true
```

If the `async` callback raises an exception, Raven will attempt to send synchronously.

We recommend creating a background job, using your background job processor,
that will send Sentry notifications in the background.
Rather than enqueuing an entire `Raven::Event` object, we recommend providing
the `Hash` representation of an event as a job argument.

Here’s an example for *Sidekiq.cr*:

```crystal
config.async = ->(event : Raven::Event) {
  # enqueue the job with a hash...
  SentryJob.async.perform(event.to_hash)
  # or with JSON string
  # SentryJob.async.perform(event.to_json)
}

class SentryJob
  include Sidekiq::Worker

  sidekiq_options do |job|
    job.queue = "sentry"
    job.retry = true
  end

  def perform(event : Raven::Event::HashType)
    Raven.send_event(event)
  end
end
```

#### transport_failure_callback

If Raven fails to send an event to Sentry for any reason
(either the Sentry server has returned a 4XX or 5XX response),
this `Proc` will be called.

```crystal
config.transport_failure_callback = ->(event : Raven::Event::HashType) {
  AdminMailer.async.perform("Oh god, it's on fire!", event)
}
```

#### Context

Much of the usefulness of Sentry comes from additional context data with the events.
Raven makes this very convenient by providing methods to set context data that
is then submitted automatically with all events.

There are three primary methods for providing request context:

```crystal
# bind the logged in user
Raven.user_context email: "foo@example.com"

# tag the request with something interesting
Raven.tags_context interesting: "yes"

# provide a bit of additional context
Raven.extra_context happiness: "very"
```

For more information, see [Context](https://docs.sentry.io/clients/ruby/context/).

## `Log` backend

`Raven::LogBackend` allows for intercepting log entries, and takes following options:

- `record_breadcrumbs` - records every log entry as Breadcrumbs
- `capture_exceptions` - captures exceptions attached to the log entry
- `capture_all` - captures every log entry

Every captured `Exception` or a `Breadcrumb` will have corresponding fields mapped
directly from the original `Log::Entry`.

Metadata will be passed as `Event#tags` and `Breadcrumb#data`, respectively.

### Usage

```crystal
# append it to the existing bindings
Log.builder.bind "*", :info, Raven::LogBackend.new(
  record_breadcrumbs: true,
  capture_exceptions: false,
  capture_all: false,
)

# or bind it within the `Log.setup` block
Log.setup do |c|
  # bind the regular io-based backend
  c.bind "*", :info, Log::IOBackend.new

  # bind raven's backend
  c.bind "*", :info, Raven::LogBackend.new(record_breadcrumbs: true)
  c.bind "*", :warn, Raven::LogBackend.new(capture_exceptions: true)
  c.bind "*", :fatal, Raven::LogBackend.new(capture_all: true)
end
```

See more in Crystal's `Log` [documentation](https://crystal-lang.org/api/Log.html#configure-logging-explicitly-in-the-code).

## Crash Handler

Since Crystal doesn't provide native handlers for unhandled exceptions
and segfaults, *raven.cr* introduces its own crash handler compiled as
external binary.

### Setup

The easiest way of using it is by adding the appropriate entry to the project's `shard.yml`:

```yaml
targets:
  # other target definitions if any...

  sentry.crash_handler:
    main: lib/raven/src/crash_handler.cr
```

With the above entry defined in `targets`, running `shards build` should result in
binary built in `bin/sentry.crash_handler`.

__NOTE__: While building you might specify `SENTRY_DSN` env variable, which will be
compiled into the binary (as plain-text) and used by the handler.

```sh
SENTRY_DSN= shards build sentry.crash_handler
```

Pass `--release` flag to disable debug messages.

### Usage

You need to run your app with previously built `bin/sentry.crash_handler` in
front.

```sh
bin/sentry.crash_handler bin/your_app --some arguments --passed to your program
```

As one would expect, `STDIN` is passed to the original process, while
`STDOUT` and `STDERR` are piped back from it.

__NOTE__: You can always pass `SENTRY_DSN` env variable during execution
in case you didn't do it while building the wrapper.

## More Information

- [Documentation](https://docs.sentry.io/clients/ruby)
- [Bug Tracker](https://github.com/Sija/raven.cr/issues)
- [Code Repository](https://github.com/Sija/raven.cr)

## Contributing

1. [Fork it](https://github.com/Sija/raven.cr/fork)
2. Create your feature branch (`git checkout -b my-new-feature`)
3. Commit your changes (`git commit -am 'Add some feature'`)
4. Push to the branch (`git push origin my-new-feature`)
5. Create a new [Pull Request](https://github.com/Sija/raven.cr/pulls)

## Contributors

- [@Sija](https://github.com/Sija) Sijawusz Pur Rahnama - creator, maintainer

types.name: Exception
types.doc:
Represents errors that occur during application execution.

Exception and its descendants are used to communicate between raise and
rescue statements in `begin ... end` blocks.
Exception objects carry information about the exception – its type (the
exception’s class name), an optional descriptive string, and
optional traceback information.
Exception subclasses may add additional information.
types.summary: Represents errors that occur during application execution.

def.name: sys_command
def.body:
result = begin
  (`(#{command}) 2>/dev/null`).strip
rescue
  nil
end
if $?.success?
  result.presence
end

instance_methods.name: category
instance_methods.doc:
Categories are dotted strings that indicate what the crumb is or where it comes from.
Typically it’s a module name or a descriptive string.
For instance `ui.click` could be used to indicate that a click happened
in the UI or `flask` could be used to indicate that the event originated
in the Flask framework.
instance_methods.summary: Categories are dotted strings that indicate what the crumb is or where it comes from.

instance_methods.name: category=
instance_methods.doc:
Categories are dotted strings that indicate what the crumb is or where it comes from.
Typically it’s a module name or a descriptive string.
For instance `ui.click` could be used to indicate that a click happened
in the UI or `flask` could be used to indicate that the event originated
in the Flask framework.
instance_methods.summary: Categories are dotted strings that indicate what the crumb is or where it comes from.

instance_methods.name: data
instance_methods.doc:
Data associated with this breadcrumb. Contains a sub-object whose
contents depend on the breadcrumb `type`. Additional parameters that
are unsupported by the type are rendered as a key/value table.
instance_methods.summary: Data associated with this breadcrumb.

instance_methods.doc:
Data associated with this breadcrumb. Contains a sub-object whose
contents depend on the breadcrumb `type`. Additional parameters that
are unsupported by the type are rendered as a key/value table.
instance_methods.summary: Data associated with this breadcrumb.

instance_methods.doc:
Data associated with this breadcrumb. Contains a sub-object whose
contents depend on the breadcrumb `type`. Additional parameters that
are unsupported by the type are rendered as a key/value table.
instance_methods.summary: Data associated with this breadcrumb.

instance_methods.doc:
This defines the level of the event. If not provided it defaults
to `info` which is the middle level.
instance_methods.summary: This defines the level of the event.

This defines the level of the event. If not provided it defaults

instance_methods.doc:
If a message is provided it’s rendered as text and the whitespace is preserved.
Very long text might be abbreviated in the UI.

instance_methods.doc: A timestamp representing when the breadcrumb occurred.
instance_methods.summary: A timestamp representing when the breadcrumb occurred.

instance_methods.doc: A timestamp representing when the breadcrumb occurred.
instance_methods.summary: A timestamp representing when the breadcrumb occurred.

instance_methods.name: type
instance_methods.doc:
The type of breadcrumb. The default type is `:default` which indicates
no specific handling. Other types are currently:
- `:http` for HTTP requests and
- `:navigation` for navigation events.
instance_methods.summary: The type of breadcrumb.

instance_methods.name: type=
instance_methods.doc:
The type of breadcrumb. The default type is `:default` which indicates
no specific handling. Other types are currently:
- `:http` for HTTP requests and
- `:navigation` for navigation events.
instance_methods.summary: The type of breadcrumb.

instance_methods.doc:
The type of breadcrumb. The default type is `:default` which indicates
no specific handling. Other types are currently:
- `:http` for HTTP requests and
- `:navigation` for navigation events.
instance_methods.summary: The type of breadcrumb.

types.name: Severity
types.doc: Levels are used in the UI to emphasize and deemphasize the crumb.
types.summary: Levels are used in the UI to emphasize and deemphasize the crumb.

types.name: Type
types.doc:
The type of breadcrumb. The default type is `Type::DEFAULT` which indicates
no specific handling. Other types are currently:
- `Type::HTTP` for HTTP requests and
- `Type::NAVIGATION` for navigation events.

instance_methods.name: each
instance_methods.doc: Must yield this collection's elements to the block.
instance_methods.summary: Must yield this collection's elements to the block.

instance_methods.name: empty?
instance_methods.doc:
Returns `true` if `self` is empty, `false` otherwise.

```
([] of Int32).empty? # => true
([1]).empty?         # => false
```
instance_methods.summary: Returns true if self is empty, false otherwise.

types.name: Client
types.doc: Encodes events and sends them to the Sentry server.
types.summary: Encodes events and sends them to the Sentry server.

def.name: send_event
def.body:
if configuration.valid?
else
  Log.debug do
    "Client#send_event with event '#{event}' failed: #{configuration.error_messages}"
  end
  return false
end
if event.is_a?(Event)
  configuration.before_send.try do |before_send|
    event = before_send.call(event, hint)
    if event
    else
      Log.info do
        "Discarded event because before_send returned nil"
      end
      return
    end
  end
end
event = event.is_a?(Event) ? event.to_hash : event
if @state.should_try?
else
  failed_send(nil, event)
  return
end
Log.info do
  "Sending event #{event[:event_id]} to Sentry"
end
content_type, encoded_data = encode(event)
begin
  options = {content_type: content_type}
  (transport.send_event(generate_auth_header, encoded_data, **options)).tap do
    successful_send
  end
rescue ex
  failed_send(ex, event)
end

def.name: send_feedback
def.body:
if configuration.valid?
else
  Log.debug do
    "Client#send_feedback with event id '#{event_id}' failed: #{configuration.error_messages}"
  end
  return false
end
transport.send_feedback(event_id, data)

def.name: transport
def.body:
if (value = @transport).nil?
  @transport = (case configuration.scheme
  when "http", "https"
    Transport::HTTP.new(configuration)
  when "dummy"
    Transport::Dummy.new(configuration)
  else
    raise("Unknown transport scheme '#{configuration.scheme}'")
  end)
else
  value
end

def.name: should_try?
def.body:
if @status.online?
  return true
end
interval = @retry_after || ({@retry_number, 6}.min ** 2).seconds
if last_check = @last_check
else
  return true
end
if (Time.utc - last_check) >= interval
  return true
end
false

constants.name: DEFAULT_PROCESSORS
constants.value: [Processor::RemoveCircularReferences, Processor::Cookies, Processor::RequestMethodData, Processor::HTTPHeaders, Processor::UTF8Conversion, Processor::SanitizeData, Processor::Compact] of Processor.class
constants.doc:
Note the order - we have to remove circular references and bad characters
before passing to other processors.
constants.summary: Note the order - we have to remove circular references and bad characters before passing to other processors.

constants.name: DEFAULT_REQUEST_METHODS_FOR_DATA_SANITIZATION
constants.doc: Array of default request methods for which data should be removed.
constants.summary: Array of default request methods for which data should be removed.

constants.name: IGNORE_DEFAULT
constants.doc: Array of exception classes that should never be sent.
constants.summary: Array of exception classes that should never be sent.

constants.name: REQUIRED_OPTIONS
constants.doc:
Array of required properties needed to be set, before
`Configuration` is considered valid.
constants.summary: Array of required properties needed to be set, before Configuration is considered valid.

instance_methods.name: async
instance_methods.doc:
Provide a `Proc` object that responds to `call` to send
events asynchronously, or pass `true` to to use standard `spawn`.

```
->(event : Raven::Event) { spawn { Raven.send_event(event) } }
```
instance_methods.summary: Provide a Proc object that responds to call to send events asynchronously, or pass true to to use standard spawn.

instance_methods.name: async=
instance_methods.doc:
Provide a `Proc` object that responds to `call` to send
events asynchronously, or pass `true` to to use standard `spawn`.

```
->(event : Raven::Event) { spawn { Raven.send_event(event) } }
```
instance_methods.summary: Provide a Proc object that responds to call to send events asynchronously, or pass true to to use standard spawn.

instance_methods.name: async=
instance_methods.doc:
Sets `async` callback to either `Fiber`-based implementation (see below),
or `nil`, depending on the given *switch* value.

```
->(event : Event) { spawn { Raven.send_event(event) } }
```
instance_methods.summary: Sets #async callback to either Fiber-based implementation (see below), or nil, depending on the given switch value.

def.name: async=
def.body:
if switch
else
  return @async = nil
end
@async = ->(event : Event) do
  spawn do
    Raven.send_event(event)
  end
  nil
end

instance_methods.name: before_send
instance_methods.doc:
Optional `Proc`, called before sending an event to the server:

```
->(event : Raven::Event, hint : Raven::Event::Hint?) {
  if hint.try(&.exception).try(&.message) =~ /database unavailable/i
    event.fingerprint << "database-unavailable"
  end
  event
}
```
instance_methods.summary: Optional Proc, called before sending an event to the server:

instance_methods.doc:

```
->(event : Raven::Event, hint : Raven::Event::Hint?) {

    event.fingerprint << "database-unavailable"
  end
  event
}
```
instance_methods.summary: Optional Proc, called before sending an event to the server:

```
  end

}
```
instance_methods.summary: Optional Proc, called before sending an event to the server:

def.name: error_messages
def.body:
errors = @errors.map_with_index do |e, i|
  i > 0 ? e.downcase : e
end
errors.join(", ")

instance_methods.name: errors
instance_methods.doc: Errors object - an `Array` containing error messages.
instance_methods.summary: Errors object - an Array containing error messages.

instance_methods.name: exclude_loggers
instance_methods.doc:
`::Log#source` patterns excluded from breadcrumb recording.

Defaults to `raven.*`.

NOTE: You should probably append to this rather than overwrite it.
instance_methods.summary: ::Log#source patterns excluded from breadcrumb recording.

instance_methods.name: exclude_loggers=
instance_methods.doc:

Defaults to `raven.*`.

NOTE: You should probably append to this rather than overwrite it.
instance_methods.summary: ::Log#source patterns excluded from breadcrumb recording.

def.name: excluded_exception?
def.body:
if ex.is_a?(Exception)
else
  return false
end
if excluded_exceptions.any? do |klass|
  case klass
  when Exception.class
    klass >= ex.class
  when String
    klass == ex.class.name
  end
end
else
  return false
end
@errors << "User excluded error: #{ex.inspect}"
true

instance_methods.name: project_root
instance_methods.doc: Project directory root for revision detection. Could be Kemal root, etc.
instance_methods.summary: Project directory root for revision detection.

def.name: project_root
def.body:
if (value = @project_root).nil?
  @project_root = (if path = Process.executable_path
    File.dirname(path)
  else
    Dir.current
  end)
else
  value
end

instance_methods.name: project_root=
instance_methods.doc: Project directory root for revision detection. Could be Kemal root, etc.
instance_methods.summary: Project directory root for revision detection.

instance_methods.name: sanitize_fields
instance_methods.doc:
By default, Sentry censors `Hash` values when their keys match things like
`"secret"`, `"password"`, etc. Provide an `Array` of `String`s that,
when matched in a hash key, will be censored and not sent to Sentry.

See `Processor::SanitizeData::DEFAULT_FIELDS`.

def.name: valid?
os_context
def.body:
if (value = @@os_context).nil?
  @@os_context = ({name: Raven.sys_command("uname -s"), version: Raven.sys_command("uname -v"), build: Raven.sys_command("uname -r"), kernel_version: (Raven.sys_command("uname -a")) || (Raven.sys_command("ver"))}.to_any_json)
else
  value
end

def.name: runtime_context
def.body:
if (value = @@runtime_context).nil?
  @@runtime_context = (begin
    v = Crystal::DESCRIPTION.match(/^(.+?) (\d+[^\n]+)\n+LLVM: (\d+[^\n]+)\nDefault target: (.+?)$/m)
    _, name, version = v.not_nil!
    {name: name, version: version}.to_any_json
  end)
else
  value
end

def.name: from
backtrace=
def.body:
backtrace = Backtracer.parse(backtrace, configuration: configuration.backtracer)
(interface(:stacktrace, backtrace: backtrace)).tap do |stacktrace|
  self.culprit || (self.culprit = (stacktrace.as(Interface::Stacktrace)).culprit)
end

def.name: list_shard_specs
def.body:
shards_list = Raven.sys_command_compiled("shards list")
if shards_list
else
  return
end
deps = shards_list.scan(/\* (?<name>.+?) \((?<version>.+?)\)/m)
if deps.empty?
else
  deps.to_h do |match|
    {match["name"], match["version"]}
  end
end

def.name: to_hash
def.body:
data = {event_id: @id, timestamp: @timestamp.to_utc.to_s("%FT%X"), level: @level.try do |__arg2|
  __arg2.to_s.downcase
end, platform: PLATFORM, sdk: SDK, logger: @logger, culprit: @culprit, server_name: @server_name, release: @release, environment: @environment, fingerprint: @fingerprint, modules: @modules, extra: @extra, tags: @tags, user: @user, contexts: @contexts, breadcrumbs: @breadcrumbs.empty? ? nil : @breadcrumbs.to_hash, message: message}.to_any_json
@interfaces.each do |name, interface|
  data[name] = interface.to_hash
end
data.to_h

types.name: Instance
types.doc:
A copy of Raven's base module class methods, minus some of the integration
and global hooks since it's meant to be used explicitly. Useful for
sending errors to multiple sentry projects in a large application.

```
class Foo
  def initialize
    @other_raven = Raven::Instance.new
    @other_raven.configure do |config|
      config.dsn = "http://..."
    end
  end

  def foo
    # ...


  rescue ex
    @other_raven.capture(ex)
  end
end
```
types.summary: A copy of Raven's base module class methods, minus some of the integration and global hooks since it's meant to be used explicitly.

instance_methods.name: annotate_exception
instance_methods.doc:
Provides extra context to the exception prior to it being handled by
Raven. An exception can have multiple annotations, which are merged
together.

The options (annotation) is treated the same as the *options*
parameter to `capture` or `Event.from`, and
can contain the same `:user`, `:tags`, etc. options as these methods.

These will be merged with the *options* parameter to
`Event.from` at the top of execution.

```
begin
  raise "Hello"
rescue ex
  Raven.annotate_exception(ex, user: {id: 1, email: "foo@example.com"})
  raise ex
end
```
instance_methods.summary: Provides extra context to the exception prior to it being handled by Raven.

def.name: annotate_exception

instance_methods.name: capture
instance_methods.doc:
Capture and process any exceptions from the given block.

```
Raven.capture do
  MyApp.run
end
```
instance_methods.summary: Capture and process any exceptions from the given block.

def.name: capture
def.body:
begin
  yield
rescue ex : Raven::Error
  raise(ex)
rescue ex : Exception
  capture(ex, **options)
  raise(ex)
end

instance_methods.name: capture
instance_methods.doc:
Captures given `Exception` or `String` object.

```
begin
  # ...
rescue ex
  Raven.capture ex
end

Raven.capture "boo!"
```
instance_methods.summary: Captures given Exception or String object.

instance_methods.name: capture
instance_methods.doc:
Captures given `Exception` or `String` object and yields
created `Raven::Event` before sending to Sentry.

```
Raven.capture("boo!") do |event|
  event.extra.merge! foo: "bar"
end
```
instance_methods.summary: Captures given Exception or String object and yields created Raven::Event before sending to Sentry.

def.name: capture
def.body:
if configuration.capture_allowed?(obj)
else
  Log.debug do
    "'#{obj}' excluded from capture: #{configuration.error_messages}"
  end
  return false
end
default_options = {configuration: configuration, context: context}
options = default_options.merge(options)
(Event.from(obj, **options)).tap do |event|
  hint = if obj.is_a?(String)
    Event::Hint.new(exception: nil, message: obj)
  else
    Event::Hint.new(exception: obj, message: nil)
  end
  yield event, hint
  if async = configuration.async
    begin
      async.call(event)
    rescue ex
      Log.error(exception: ex) do
        "Async event sending failed"
      end
      send_event(event, hint)
    end
  else
    send_event(event, hint)
  end
  @last_event_id_mutex.synchronize do
    @last_event_id = event.id
  end
  (obj.as?(Exception)).try(&.__raven_event_id=(event.id))
end

instance_methods.name: capture
instance_methods.doc:
Captures an exception with given *klass*, *message*
and optional *backtrace*.

```
Raven.capture "FooBarError", "Foo got bar!"
```

NOTE: Useful in scenarios where you need to reconstruct the error
(usually along with a backtrace from external source), while
having no access to the actual Exception object.
instance_methods.summary: Captures an exception with given klass, message and optional backtrace.
instance_methods.args_string: (klass : String, message : String, backtrace : String? = nil, **options, &)

def.name: capture
def.body:
formatted_message = "#{klass}: #{message}"
capture(formatted_message, **options) do |event|
  ex = Interface::SingleException.new.tap do |iface|
    iface.module = (klass.split("::"))[0...-1].join("::")
    iface.type = klass
    iface.value = message
    if backtrace
      parsed = Backtracer.parse(backtrace, configuration: configuration.backtracer)
      iface.stacktrace = Interface::Stacktrace.new(backtrace: parsed).tap do |stacktrace|
        event.culprit = stacktrace.culprit
      end
    end
  end
  event.interface(:exception, values: [ex])
  yield event
end

instance_methods.name: captured_exception?
instance_methods.doc:
Returns `true` in case given *ex* was already captured,
`false` otherwise.

```
ex = Exception.new("boo!")

Raven.captured_exception?(ex) # => false
Raven.capture(ex)
Raven.captured_exception?(ex) # => true
```
instance_methods.summary: Returns true in case given ex was already captured, false otherwise.

instance_methods.name: extra_context
instance_methods.doc:
Bind extra context. Merges with existing context (if any).

Extra context shows up as *Additional Data* within Sentry,
and is completely arbitrary.

```
Raven.extra_context(my_custom_data: "value")
```
instance_methods.summary: Bind extra context.

instance_methods.name: extra_context
instance_methods.doc:
Bind extra context.
Merges with existing context (if any).

See `#extra_context`
instance_methods.summary: Bind extra context.

def.name: extra_context
def.body:
prev_context = context.extra.clone
begin
  context.extra.merge!(hash, options)
  yield
ensure
  context.extra = prev_context
end
context.extra

instance_methods.name: report_status
instance_methods.doc: Tell the log that the client is good to go.
instance_methods.summary: Tell the log that the client is good to go.

def.name: report_status
def.body:
if configuration.silence_ready?
  return
end
if configuration.capture_allowed?
  Log.info do
    "Raven #{VERSION} ready to catch errors"
  end
else
  Log.info do
    "Raven #{VERSION} configured not to capture errors: #{configuration.error_messages}"
  end
end

instance_methods.name: send_event
instance_methods.doc:
Send an event to the configured Sentry server.

```
event = Raven::Event.new(message: "An error")
Raven.send_event(event)
```
instance_methods.summary: Send an event to the configured Sentry server.

instance_methods.name: send_feedback
instance_methods.doc:
Sends User Feedback to Sentry server.

*data* should be a `Hash(String, String)` with following keys:
- *name* (populated from `context.user[:username]` if left empty)
- *email* (populated from `context.user[:email]` if left empty)
- *comments*

```
Raven.send_feedback(Raven.last_event_id, {
  "name"     => "...",
  "email"    => "...",
  "comments" => "...",
})
```

NOTE: Sentry server records single (last) feedback for a given *event_id*.
instance_methods.summary: Sends User Feedback to Sentry server.

def.name: send_feedback
def.body:
if username = context.user[:username]?
  data["name"]? || (data["name"] = username.to_s)
end
if email = context.user[:email]?
  data["email"]? || (data["email"] = email.to_s)
end
client.send_feedback(event_id, data)

instance_methods.name: tags_context
instance_methods.doc:
Bind tags context. Merges with existing context (if any).

Tags are key / value pairs which generally represent things like
application version, environment, role, and server names.

```
Raven.tags_context(my_custom_tag: "tag_value")
```
instance_methods.summary: Bind tags context.

instance_methods.doc:

See `#tags_context`

  context.tags.merge!(hash, options)
  yield
ensure
  context.tags = prev_context
end
context.tags

instance_methods.name: user_context
instance_methods.doc:
Bind user context. Merges with existing context (if any).

It is recommending that you send at least the `:id` and `:email`
values. All other values are arbitrary.

```
Raven.user_context(id: 1, email: "foo@example.com")
```
instance_methods.summary: Bind user context.

def.name: to_hash
method
def.body:
if (value = @method).nil?
  ::raise(NilAssertionError.new("Raven::Interface::HTTP#method cannot be nil"))
else
  value
end

def.name: url
def.body:
if (value = @url).nil?
  ::raise(NilAssertionError.new("Raven::Interface::HTTP#url cannot be nil"))
else
  value
end

def.name: message
def.body:
if (value = @message).nil?
  ::raise(NilAssertionError.new("Raven::Interface::Message#message cannot be nil"))
else
  value
end

def.name: unformatted_message
def.body:
if params = @params
  params.empty? ? message? : message?.try do |m|
    m % params
  end
else
  message?
end

def.name: type
def.body:
if (value = @type).nil?
  ::raise(NilAssertionError.new("Raven::Interface::SingleException#type cannot be nil"))
else
  value
end

def.name: value
def.body:
if (value = @value).nil?
  ::raise(NilAssertionError.new("Raven::Interface::SingleException#value cannot be nil"))
else
  value
end

types.doc: Not actually an interface, but I want to use the same style
types.summary: Not actually an interface, but I want to use the same style

def.name: from_backtrace_frame
def.body:
new.tap do |frame|
  frame.abs_path = line.absolute_path || line.path
  frame.filename = line.relative_path
  frame.function = line.method
  frame.package = line.shard_name
  frame.lineno = line.lineno
  frame.colno = line.column
  frame.in_app = line.in_app?
  if context = line.context
    frame.pre_context, frame.context_line, frame.post_context = context.pre, context.line, context.post
  end
end

types.name: LogBackend
types.doc:
`::Log::Backend` recording logged messages.

```
Log.setup do |c|
  c.bind "*", :info, Log::IOBackend.new
  c.bind "*", :info, Raven::LogBackend.new(record_breadcrumbs: true)
  c.bind "*", :warn, Raven::LogBackend.new(capture_exceptions: true)
  c.bind "*", :fatal, Raven::LogBackend.new(capture_all: true)
end
```

def.name: new

_ = allocate
_.initialize(record_breadcrumbs: record_breadcrumbs, capture_exceptions: capture_exceptions, capture_all: capture_all, default_logger: default_logger)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

instance_methods.name: write
instance_methods.doc: Writes the *entry* to this backend.
instance_methods.summary: Writes the entry to this backend.

def.name: write
def.body:
if (!active?) || (ignored_logger?(entry.source))
  return
end
data = entry.context.extend(entry.data.to_h)
data = data.empty? ? nil : (JSON.parse(data.to_json)).as_h
message = entry.message
ex = entry.exception
if capture?
  if ex || capture_all?
    capture_exception(ex, message, entry.severity, entry.timestamp, entry.source, data)
  end
end
if record_breadcrumbs?
  if ex
    message = message + " -- (#{ex.class}): #{ex.message || "n/a"}"
  end
  record_breadcrumb(message, entry.severity, entry.timestamp, entry.source, data)
end

types.name: InitializeWith
types.doc:
Maps passed *attributes* to `@ivar_variables` and `self.property_setters=`.

```
class Foo
  include Raven::Mixin::InitializeWith

  @logger : String?
  property message : String?

  def backtrace=(backtrace)
    # ...
  end
end

foo = Foo.new
foo.initialize_with({
  logger:    "my-logger",
  message:   "boo!",
  backtrace: caller,
})
```

NOTE: Magic inside!

def.name: initialize_with
process
def.body:
if (data.responds_to?(:"empty?")) && data.empty?
  return
end
case data
when Hash
  data.each do |k, v|
    data[k] = process(v)
  end
  data.compact!
  data.to_h
when Array
  data.map! do |v|
    (process(v)).as(typeof(v))
  end
else
  data
end

def.name: process
def.body:
if data.is_a?(Hash)
else
  return data
end
data = data.to_any_json
if req = (data[:request]?.as?(Hash)).try(&.to_any_json)
  if req[:cookies]?
    req[:cookies] = nil
  end
  if req[:headers, "Cookie"]?
    req[:headers, "Cookie"] = nil
  end
end
data.to_h

def.name: process
def.body:
if data.is_a?(Hash)
else
  return data
end
data = data.to_any_json
if headers = data[:request, :headers]?.as?(Hash)
  headers.keys.select! do |__arg0|
    __arg0.to_s.matches?(fields_pattern)
  end.each do |key|
    headers[key] = STRING_MASK
  end
end
data.to_h

def.name: process
def.body:
if data.responds_to?(:object_id)
else
  return data
end
if visited.includes?(data.object_id)
  return "(...)"
end
case data
when Hash
  visited << data.object_id
  data.each do |k, v|
    begin
      data[k] = process(v, visited)
    rescue
      "!!!"
    end
  end
  data
when Array
  visited << data.object_id
  data.map! do |v|
    (process(v, visited)).as(typeof(v))
  end
else
  data
end

def.name: process
def.body:
if data.is_a?(Hash)
else
  return data
end
data = data.to_any_json
(data[:exception, :values]?.as?(Array)).try(&.each do |e|
  (e.as?(Hash)).try(&.delete(:stacktrace))
end)
data.to_h

def.name: process
def.body:
if data.is_a?(Hash)
else
  return data
end
data = data.to_any_json
if sanitize_request_method?(data[:request, :method]?)
  data[:request, :data] = nil
end
data.to_h

instance_methods.name: process
instance_methods.doc: ameba:disable Metrics/CyclomaticComplexity
instance_methods.summary: ameba:disable Metrics/CyclomaticComplexity

def.name: process
def.body:
case value
when Hash
  process(value)
when Array
  value.map do |i|
    (process(key, i)).as(AnyHash::JSONTypes::Value)
  end
when String
  case
  when (value =~ fields_pattern) && (json = parse_json_or_nil(value))
    (process(json)).to_json
  when matches_regexes?(key, value)
    STRING_MASK
  when (key == (:query_string)) || (key == "query_string")
    sanitize_query_string(value)
  else
    value
  end
when Number
  matches_regexes?(key, value) ? INT_MASK : value
else
  value
end

def.name: process
def.body:
case data
when Hash(String, JSON::Any)
  data = data.each_with_object(AnyHash::JSON.new) do |__arg0, memo|
    k = __arg0[0]
    v = __arg0[1]
    case v = v.raw
    when AnyHash::JSONTypes::Value
      memo[k] = process(k, v)
    end
  end
  data.to_h
when Hash
  data = data.each_with_object(data.to_any_json) do |__arg1, memo|
    k = __arg1[0]
    v = __arg1[1]
    memo[k] = process(k, v)
  end
  data.to_h
else
  data
end

def.name: process
def.body:
case data
when Hash
  data.each do |k, v|
    data[k] = process(v)
  end
  data.to_h
when Array
  data.map! do |v|
    (process(v)).as(typeof(v))
  end
when Exception
  if message = data.message
  else
    return data
  end
  if message.valid_encoding?
    return data
  end
  (data.class.new(clean_invalid_utf8_bytes(message), data.cause)).tap do |ex|
    ex.callstack = data.callstack
  end
when String
  if data.valid_encoding?
    return data
  end
  clean_invalid_utf8_bytes(data)
else
  data
end

def.name: send_event
def.body: events << {auth_header: auth_header, data: data.to_s, options: options}.to_any_json

def.name: send_event
def.body:
if configuration.capture_allowed?
else
  Log.debug do
    "Event not sent: #{configuration.error_messages}"
  end
  return
end
project_id = configuration.project_id
path = configuration.path.try(&.chomp('/'))
headers = ::HTTP::Headers {"X-Sentry-Auth" => auth_header, "Content-Type" => options[:content_type]}
if configuration.encoding.gzip?
  headers["Content-Encoding"] = "gzip"
end
Log.debug do
  "HTTP Transport connecting to #{configuration.dsn}"
end
client = build_client
(client.post("#{path}/api/#{project_id}/store/", headers, data)).tap do |response|
  if response.success?
  else
    raise(Error.new(response))
  end
end

def.name: send_feedback
def.body:
headers = ::HTTP::Headers.new
if origin = configuration.dsn
  headers["Origin"] = origin
end
params = ::HTTP::Params.build do |form|
  form.add("eventId", event_id)
  form.add("dsn", configuration.dsn)
end
path = String.build do |str|
  str << configuration.path.try(&.chomp('/'))
  str << "/api/embed/error-page/?"
  str << params
end
Log.debug do
  "HTTP Transport connecting to #{path}"
end
client = build_client
(client.post(path, form: data, headers: headers)).tap do |response|
  if response.success?
  else
    raise(Error.new(response))
  end
end
